channel.title: They bent our ear
channel.description:
Dramatic readings of 14 travelers who came to the United States in 1820-1850 and wrote of what they saw.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Captain Basil Hall
item.description: This program focuses on Captain Basil Hall and his "Travels in North America."
item.dc:creator: Miller, Perry, 1905-1963
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Charles Dickens
item.description: This program focuses on the writings of Charles Dickens and his experiences in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Miller, Perry, 1905-1963
item.dc:subject: Writing

item.title: Frances Trollope
item.description: This program focuses on Frances Trollope and her "Domestic Manners of the Americans."
item.dc:creator: Miller, Perry, 1905-1963
item.dc:subject: United States--History--19th century

item.title: Harriet Martineau
item.description: This program focuses on Harriet Martineau's writings about her travels to the United States.
